Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Nausea \Nau"se*a\ (? or ?), n. [L., fr. Gr. ?, fr. nay^s ship. See {Nave} of a church, and cf. {Noise}.] Seasickness; hence, any similar sickness of the stomach accompanied with a propensity to vomit; qualm; squeamishness of the stomach; loathing. [1913 Webster]
nausea n 1: the state that precedes vomiting [syn: {sickness}] 2: disgust so strong it makes you feel sick
